text: This is a really cute little Mexican place on Broadway. There are probably 10 tables altogether. I came in with a bitchin' hangover and mowed down on the chips and both kinds of salsa-- the red is a little spicier than the verde but both have a serious kick and are delicious. For my entree I had the steak flautas. They were pretty good but I blame myself for not ordering something dripping in cheese given my current tragic state. That's on me though, not them! I really enjoyed the dollop of guacamole on my plate as well as the refried beans. I've had bland renditions of both items before and that definitely wasn't the case here.  Service was fine too-- she kept my water glass refilled and remembered not to put sour cream on my meal so I was more than satisfied. I definitely like this place and will go back again for sure when I'm running errands in Lakeview. They are BYOB; although I didn't indulge this time as I had done plenty of damage the night before I definitely will next time.

This place is amazing. We stopped in to get dinner and the food was incredible. I ordered the cheese enchiladas con mole and my friend ordered the steak flautas. 10 out of 10. You have to come here. New favorite spot. The beans and rice were so tasty and the main dishes were out of this world. My mole was so flavorful.

The food was fantastic! Very authentic and the servers are very friendly. The prices were very fair for the meals. You get a lot of food for what you are paying for. When you first walk in you get free chips and salsa :)

I'm new to Chicago and we went here the second night of living here.  Holy mole!  And I mean holy mole, the mole sauce is amazing!    Everything was delicious.  I was especially happy with the salsa, so flavorful and a nice spice to it.  Our table had the burrito, the taco salad, and the carne asada.  Although the portions are very large we still managed to clean our plates of the delicious food!  This will be my regular mexican spot!  Also love that it is BYOB.

Something keeps bringing me back - it's the chicken quesadilla. This thing is addicting and DELICIOUS. The cheese is the perfect melt, the chicken is simple, the guac and sour cream combo does it just right. I also found out in addition to the 7% cash back, they have 20% cash back on Groupon (15% after the first purchase)! So along with all that PLUS free dessert check in (which the fried ice cream wins, hands down), this place is such a great deal.

Came here expecting good things, and we ate good things :) Delicious chips & salsa: the chips were firm enough to hold the salsa and crispy enough to get a satisfying crunch without any excess oil or salt. Both salsas were hot, but I loved the salsa verse better. The Queso Fundido was as fun to eat as it looked: the breakable fried tortilla shell played double duty as bowl/chips and the queso was creamy and flavorful. The chorizo added enough heat to boost the bite in the cheese. The Enchiladas Verdes was a delicious blend of chicken, corn tortillas, a delicious sauce, and topped with green salsa, cheese and sour cream. The sauce and toppings were not overwhelming the tortillas (they stayed firm and not soggy), and the rice and beans were light and savory. The Steak Fajitas dinner was just my style! It came out sizzling on a skillet, the crisp thick cut veggies and tender chunks of steak covered with a delectable glaze was the dish I was looking for! It took eight corn tortillas to finish the platter; the rice and beans were on point here as well. For dessert, we received a $free$ Nieve Frita for checking in on Yelp, and just like to entrees, this ice cream was a very large portion! I have never tried this before and I enjoyed the contrast in textures from crispy shell to velvety center.  All in all, this small ten table restaurant has moved its way up into my heart, and the family that owns it has done a fine job!

Ordered a beef burrito for delivery; the description was simply beef, lettuce, tomato, sour cream, cheese, and beans. What I received was a burrito containing only beef, beans, and for some reason.... stewed carrots?!? The stewed carrots gave the beef a "is this rotten" flavor. Not to mention I am allergic to carrots.  TLDR: nasty taste, left out half the ingredients, I got hives.

People, this is how proper Mexican food is prepared. No fake hipster ingredients (or hipster menu prices!) just simple, authentic Mexican food. I've been coming here for years and have never been disappointed. The tacos are solid, get the Taco Dinner which comes with 2x tacos plus rice and beans for under $10. They're delicious! The Enchiladas Mole is also very tasty and filling. For anyone dining in, it's BYOB and they put a basket of tortilla chips along with red and green salsa, free of charge, on the table while you wait for your main dishes to arrive. Staff are always friendly and attentive too. Highly recommended.

This place has authentic Mexican food and a pleasant atmosphere. Enchiladas de mole (chicken) had great flavor. You will be fed well here. Staff is very kind. This is a good spot for tasty Mexican food at an affordable price.  Groupon and Yelp both offer card-linked deals for cash-back when you dine in. Yelp also currently offering a free dessert when you check-in here.  This place gets 6 stars when you combine all the deals to an already affordable price. Make sure to tip on the original price!

Service is very friendly and food is good.  The horchata here is decent. Not the best, but definitely complements the food nicely. I ordered a steak milanesa torta as well. Parts of the steak were a little nervy but most of it was tender. I wish the breading on the milanesa was a little crisper but overall it tasted really great.  Will return, good Mexican food in Lakeview.
Good casual Mexican in the neighborhood. We picked up and ate at home so probably better in house. BYOB is always nice. Tampenquena with mole enchiladas was yummy! Guacamolewas fresh and good.

Decent Mexican with an even better price tag and BYOB as the icing on the cake. Carne asada was flavorful, a bit chewy which can be expected but overall I'd order again. The sour cream that comes with seriously tastes like frosting but in a good way. The mole was good as well, my boyfriend thought it was almost too rich (tasted like chocolate) but I'd say it was perfect  Only negative was the guac- needed more salt and lime or something.. a bit bland for my liking but I doctored it up a bit  Flan was great as well.  Will be back.

The reason for 5 stars... close to the house, great food, stellar service, small and quaint, reasonably priced and BYOB.  If you are looking for a nice, quiet "laying low" evening, I would highly recommend Buena Vista.

The food I ordered from Buena Vista was delicious. I discovered this restaurant via Grub Hub. Any time I've ordered from Grub Hub it's been hit or miss so I didn't have any expectations from Buena Vista.  I was impressed by the selection that they had to offer.  They offer many of the traditional dishes that a lot of the Mexican restaurants in the area don't offer.  The food was delivered a little bit earlier then projected so we were excited. My boyfriend wasn't 100% sold on the restaurant so he ordered tacos but he was thoroughly impressed when he tried them. For a $2.50 taco they were absolutely delicious. We were a little surprised that the tacos were delivered on paper plates when they first arrived but the plates kept them from getting shuffled around during delivery.  I ordered the steak burrito along with a steak taco. I wanted to see how the tacos tasted since I knew my boyfriend wouldn't want to share if they were delicious haha. The tacos were good but I'd definitely recommend putting the sauce on it because it'll help moisten the meat.  I was extremely impressed with the burrito! From the first bite it was warm, extremely moist, and so flavorful. I would highly recommend the burrito because it's the most bang for your buck and you won't be disappointed. I didn't get the burrito with the mole sauce so I can't comment on that one but from all the photos on Yelp it seems like a popular item. If you order beverages they deliver the drinks in a cooler to keep them chilled. That's a great touch because having warm food and a cold drink gives you the effect of being at the restaurant. This is definitely my new go to place whenever I'm craving a burrito!

Consistently amazing and incredibly cheap--my significant other and I always manage to get dinner here for less than $20 total. It's BYOB, and I've never had poor service--in roughly 10 visits to the restaurant, not to mention the number of times I get takeout. The steak burrito, enchiladas suizas, and queso fundido are the only dishes I can personally vouch for, but all are some of the best I've had.
We ordered take out through the Yelp app. They had our food ready by the time we walked over. Yummy nachos and burritos! Super fast service! Friendly staff!
$2 tacos (al pastor!) & BYOB. Chips come with 2 salsas. Be aware, they are spicy. Don't come with a group larger than 4 because you might not be able to grab a table in this very tiny restaurant.

This is my go to spot if I want to pick up Mexican take out. I get the flutas which is so freaking good!  Also you can dine in and it's BYOB. Not big space so maybe not for large crowds. But I've been here a good amount of times and the food has been consistently good. Hungry just from writing this review...
Good Americanized Mexican food. Good Margaritas. Tiny place. Good service. A few patio seats during the summer.

Buena Vista is a step up from your standard counter serve Mexican place, but it's still a no frills Mexican joint.  They do have BYOB, so that's a definite plus.  To start off, they bring you the standard chips and salsa while you look over the menu, and the 2 sauces are very good.  The wife and I decided on the nachos as an app and then I got a burrito al pastor.  The nachos were better than your average pub's nachos and the burrito was very good, but a little low on meat.  I only got the a la carte option but it's huge and certainly more than enough for lunch.  My wife ordered a chicken and an al pastor taco.  They were ok, but nothing you can't get at just about any Mexican place.  Overall it's a good option for a quickish lunch or dinner.  The staff was very welcoming and attentive, and we enjoyed the food.

This would have been 5 stars. We ordered through Grub Hub for delivery. One of the items we ordered was a side of guacamole fire $2.50. They sent us guacamole in a 1 oz condiment container. Felt like they price gauged us on that. Otherwise, the food that we ordered (huevos y Chorizo, flaunts, and taco dinners) were delicious.

Came here for lunch in person, very good service and great authentic food! Salsa was very good! Horchata as well - was very quick in and out but we definitely could have stayed longer. They also have the Horchata to go which was nice :)

I've found it very hard to find a good Mexican place but this place is good.  I'm a tacos kind of girl, but I literally order the Pollo Buena Vista EVERYTIME, and it is literally one of the only leftovers that I actually end up reheating and eating the next day with utter joy. And they have horchata !

As an appetizer, we had the shrimp cocktail with a Mexican twist.  The cocktail sauce had a mixture of jalapeño peppers and avocado.  It was interesting and tasty. BYOB.....no set up charge and they provide wine glasses.  Their tacos are garden variety with fresh ingredients.  The seating area is very small, 8 or 9 tables.  The chips and salsa were very good.  They have both green and red salsa.  Very affordable.
Awesome place. Great authentic Mexican food. The best homemade salsa I've had in the city. The fajitas and flautas are bomb. I highly recommend this place and I'm glad we found it.
I've never been here but I always order delivery! Fast service, good food! Love their chicken flautas!

Very straight forward little Mexican cantina. Not very big, comfy ambiance. Service is good. The chips and salsa arrive within a minute after being seated, and both the green and traditional varieties are good. The chicken quesadilla and flautas are very good. They also have a good shrimp ceviche, but only on weekends. BYOB

Ordered here for carry out on a Monday night. We actually initially tried to order online and use a promo coupon but experienced multiple errors with the order going through. We called in instead and they were more than happy to accommodate and honor the coupon over the phone which was great of them! The food was ready very quickly - basically in the time it took to walk over there. Everything we ordered was exceptional, I had been craving a burrito for a few days and was more than satisfied. The food/ingredients were high quality, not your run of the mill cheap Mexican. This was particularly impressive considering how cheap the prices were. Our total price for two people was about the same as I'd pay at a smaller place with cheaper quality like Janitzio Burrito down the street . I personally think that Buena Vista and El Nuevo Mexicano are the two best Mexican spots in the area - both offering different/unique experiences. I will definitely try dining in next time since they have a nice front patio space and have a BYOB policy which you can never go wrong with. Highly recommend this place if you are looking for some good quality Mexican food for carryout or dine in!
First time here, service and food were all really good, place is BYOB which we like. Restaurant is a little small but had no problem getting in, although we were a little early in the night.
pretty good and authentic. it's small and tight space, but the service was really good. I got the burrito suzia with steak and it was very good!

Ordered Carry out because the reviews were very positive. Nice staff but was extremely disappointed with most of the food. I say most of the food, because this shrimp ceviche was abundant, fresh and delicious. However the steak enchiladas were some of the worst I have ever had. The steak was very rubbery and extremely fatty, causing me to spit out most of it. The tortillas were dry and they packed very little lettuce/tomato.  I wouldn't mind paying a premium for good food but this occasion had me overpaying for low quality food.  Won't return

Good food for a cheap price. I think our bill was under $40 and we got an appetizer, two entrees, and a pina colada. The guacamole was OK, seemed like it was missing lime juice/salt. The entrees were very delicious and the pina colada was amazing. The complimentary chips were ok but the green sauce was nice and spicy, we used that to top off our entrees. I got the bistek a la mexicana and my gf got the chicken fajitas. I really loved my dish and I think she liked her chicken fajitas. It seems to be BYOB, but this was a random pick for dinner. It's small outside and service could have been better, but I'd come back here for some good food.
I really enjoyed the chicken tacos and the rice was great as well. Someone said you can't really mess up a taco and I disagree. The chicken tacos has great flavor:) Good service too...

Wonderful experience!  The food was plentiful and fantastic, the service great.   The ambience was a small 'hole in the wall' type joint.   I think great Mexican should have excellent sauces.  There was Great mole, great garlic sauce, great guac, as well as 2 salsas at the beginning.   Outdoor seating and byob!

It took my food an hour to arrive from .5 miles away after pick up, but that was via Door Dash so I can't blame Buena, but it did get cold food.  The chorizo was extremely tasty but very greasy, a touch to much to be enjoyable as it was a mess to eat. Maybe if it didn't sit very long it would be awesome. The chicken taco was very juicy but a bit bland without dumping a ton of salsa.  I was miffed at the side of gauc which was an ounce for $2.50, a huge rip off.  I will try this again.

Me and the bf ordered delivery from here the other night, and I'd say it was just ok. We had chips & salsa and carne asada tacos with cilantro and onions. The chips and salsa were just ok. The chips were cooked nicely, but had literally no salt on them, leaving something to be desired. The salsa roja was actually quite spicy (which is a plus). Tacos were just ok, nothing special. They were a little skimpy on the meat. The meat was average. The tortillas were meh. I got a stomach ache after eating, which was unpleasant. Wouldn't go back.
great food, great prices and its BYOB! i like to order the enchiladas everytime i go and 6 pack or my favorite beer. the restaurant is a little small but its worth it. give it a  try !
This place is a hidden gem! The food is great and the staff is friendly. Fun place for BYOB before the Laugh Factory. I will def be back!

It's great, cheap, fast Mexican BYOB. Whatever that makes you think of, it is exactly that.  Have been many times, always delicious! Friendly staff, a few outside tables when it's warm out.  Was disappointed by the guac that time we got it, though. Pure mashed avocado, not enough lime or salt for my tastes.

This place was great, and cheap too. It's hard to find good Mexican food (particularly a place with tamales) that will be delivered. I ordered via Yelp, was here in 45 min (was told 1 hour). I got the Tamales Suizos which were really good! Sometimes tamales are either really dry or really mushy and these were perfect. The tomato based sauce on top was surprisingly good too, but I prefer something salsa based. You also get 3 instead of 2. I also got a solo chicken taco to get my order above the delivery minimum - it was good, nothing special - there's a place by me that has better tacos. I will definitely order from here again though for the tamales and bang for your buck!

Excellent service and food. The Pollo Buena Vista is my favorite dish on the menu, but I've never been disappointed with anything I've ordered from here. It's all delicious, and a great value! But what keeps me coming back is the service! They treat you like family here, and even remember my order when I go back! Wonderful family owned and operated restaurant, definitely one of Chicago's gems, highly recommend it!!

Excellent service, delicious food and BYOB! What more could one ask for with extremely reasnable prices? Friendly staff. Highly recommended! It also has delivery and when the food is delivered, it is still hot. I love this place and will return again.

The other reviews are not lying when they say that this place is SMALL! But others are also correct in that Buena Vista offers a great bang for your buck (my 3 friends and I spent $40 on dinner) and pretty quality food, at that.  This place offers all your standard Mexican options, including burritos, enchiladas, tacos, sopas, etc. It's also BYOB, so we enjoyed some nice margarita mix before heading over to a comedy show at laugh factory right down the street. No complaints about this place!

I just had three tacos; two pastor and one carne asada.  The not so good: The carne asada taco was tough and didn't have a lot of flavor, even though they put "everything" on it. Lettuce, tomatoes, onions and cheese. To me a authentic tacos should have onions and cilantro only. I understand that might be a regional standard, both regionally in Mexico and regionally in Chicago. I noticed that, depending on what hood your in, ordering a steak taco will get you different toppings. In more "ethnic" neighborhoods, places that I like to eat, always just put on cilantro and onion. In Lakeview/Lincoln park I understand that tastes are different, hence the lettuce, tomato, cheese combination. I'm not saying one way is right and the other is wrong. Ultimately, this was my mistake in assuming the taco would have what I want on it and I don't fault the restaurant at all. However, the flavor was mute on this taco and I probably wouldn't order it again.  The Good: All three tacos have plenty of stuffing in nice fluffy corn tortillas. They automatically included four salsa cups and limes without me asking (BONUS!!). Three tacos were plenty for lunch and I'm a bit stuffed. The pretty awesome: The pastor tacos are excellent! No, not an instant favorite or top 5 in the city or anything, but I am really impressed. This hood is a toss up for a lot of cuisine and I was just surprised at how solid these two pastor tacos are. Onions and cilantro only standard. A bit on the greasy side, but if you're ordering pastor that's not uncommon. Need a bit of salt but great flavor and texture overall. If you're in the area, there aren't a lot of solid taco options like this so this was a welcome surprise and I'm glad I chanced it. Now, would I forgo my hood's tacos or travel to get these particular tacos? No way, but if you're within a 1-1.5 miles away, I don't see why you'd go anywhere else. These and Del Sol tacos (not authentic, but delicious) are now the two that I'll recommend. Yes, I am a fan of this place! I ordered takeout but the service seems very nice. Clean little place. I'll have to try a dinner plate if I'm seeing a show or if I'm stuck in Lakeview after work for some reason. I'll definitely be back. Note: I have not tried every taco joint in the 2 mile radius but I have tried a lot. Tacos are 1 or 2 on my favorite list and my diet is roughly 60% tacos. Not an exaggeration. About 60% tacos in one form or another.

Stopped by for a late dinner with the family, and had the chicken enchiladas in a mole sauce fricking good. We also ordered the alpastor sopes also very delicious. The cinnamon horchata was awesome! You get a lot for your buck at this place and great customer service. Oh and very fast! A definite return visit is in the works.

I came here recently with the boyfriend for a low key night out.  I think they're known more for being a delivery spot but we enjoyed dining in very much.  The food was much more restaurant style than I expected, I think I was expecting more Chipotle style given the modest decor.  Great portion sizes and best of all its BYOB.  We will definitely be back!

Pretty good. I'd return.  Food was pretty good. I ordered the chicken quesadillas and they were good. Had nice flavor to them. 'Twas slightly 'Tex Mexy' but flavorful and filling nonetheless. The table salsa and chips were good. The red salsa was very unassuming but had a firecracker kick. I wasn't expecting that because it looked kinda average; to wit, my expectations were low. The Guac was disappointing as it lacked flavor and character. It was too thin and had a real grocery store bought vibe to it.  The ambiance was cute. It's a pretty tiny place. We were pretty crowded with the folks behind and adjacent to us. It was cute and cozy nonetheless.  The prices were definitely reasonable. What you see here cost a simple $9.91 wow!  The staff were very polite and professional. The music wasn't loud or invasive, which I very much appreciated. It was just right.  Just as I was finishing up I heard the guy behind the order taking a delivery order - so nice to know they deliver. I'll definitely be back.
Wonderful dinner! We ordered delivery. It was here in about 30 minutes! The food was warm and fresh. Delicious salsa served with the meal. Great comfort Mexican food.

Ordered  delivery.com  Friday night. Arrived hot and fresh and yummy in less than an hour.  Fantastic green sauce (on the chicken enchiladas verde). Red sauce is spicy, buyer beware. Beans are solid, rice is a bit dry and bland. But, ya know, beans and rice are beans and rice. Ordering again (it's Tuesday lol) - trying the famous burrito!
Good low frills Mexican.  Everything seems fresh and made right there.  Only downside- not a lot of vegetarian options

Ordered delivery for the first time.  We got the steak tacos and the guac.  They were delicious.  I preferred the onion and cilantro steak tacos to the traditional toppings.  We also thought the steak was better than the chicken.  Delivery was fast and the prices were good.  Very tasty!

I came back this time I tried their fajitas.  OMG it was the best fajitas I have ever had in my life.  I asked for some jalapeños mixed with the fajitas to give it a little kick and it just was phenomenal.  I can't say enough good things about this establishment it is family owned and they care for their customers like no other.  When it comes to Mexican this is the only place would go. QUE RICO !

Ordered delivery for the first time from here based off reviews. Received my order of rice, beans, salsa and chips, and 2 ground beef tacos. I bit in to the taco and spit out a huge clump of hair. Called the restaurant and they said they could redeliver or credit me. Since I paid cash i asked for credit. I don't want to eat ANY of this food nor do I want reorder from here. What a waste of 17 bucks.
Echoing everything said already - good food that is served quickly by a superfriendly staff in an unpretentious setting...amazing value for money
Chicken enchiladas de mole was divine. Just the right moisture and spiciness. The enchiladas were stuffed with shredded chicken the salad had crema.  We had delivery and it arrived hot.

Best Mexican spot in Chicago.  The owner will treat you like family and always has great service.  Their food is always well prepared and their restaurant is great to pop into for a quick bite.  Highly recommend the mini chimichanga for a meal or to share for a four top.  Enjoy!

I love places that surprise.  This is one of them.  Great come as you are, comfortable, neighborhoody atmosphere.  Shrimp cocktail was amazing, fajitas were excellent, and the enchiladas hit the spot.  Definitely enjoyed the BYOB.  Can see this place being a regular mainstay.

Picked this lovely spot on a whim and it was a fantastic choice! Buena Vista is a tiny restaurant (maybe 8 tables for 2) with tasty, unfussy Mexican food. There's not much to say, the tostados and salsa are fresh, the dishes are plentiful but not gargantuan/ridiculous. Staff are friendly and busy, so while it's a casual place, it feels kinda intimate. Great flavors that are not unexpected for Mexican food, but definitely thoughtfully executed. So good! Also, please please. Don't come here with your double-wide stroller or 15 shopping bags, and keep your voice at a reasonable level. This is a place to enjoy yummy food, not take up a ton of figurative and literal space.

Decided to check out this place because it was BYOB and also close to my apartment. I was pleasantly surprised. I liked their salsa because I feel that it's spicier than most other restaurants' and I LOVE spicy. I ordered the flautas(?) and they were delicious. I will be back and recumbent recommend!
Good Mexican food at Good prices.  BYOB and so small the service is always pretty good. I like their enchiladas. Their table salsa is very spicy.

Authentic, huge portions, and I don't even shit my brains out when I am done! If you are looking for a small Mexican place that gives you too much food for not much money, then this spot is the bee's knees. Each time I go there it's just this one woman seating and waiting on everybody and she works her ASS off, so tip big you cheap douche. I go with the burrito each time and the thing is a big as a god damned baby. The place is BYOB as well and you can bring anything, including whiskey. I can't tell you how much fun it is to throw back a ton of whiskey and then be handed a baby-sized burrito literally ten minutes after I order it. They also provide chips and two types of salsa (huge deal for me). The green salsa has a very fresh taste to it and is not too spicy. The red salsa reminds me of crack because it ruins my night but I keep going back to it. So, if you haven't been yet I highly recommend going. It makes Taco Bell look like Taco Bell.
This place has really good food. We got the chicken fajitas, enchiladas with mole and it was all good. Service is really good. Servers are very nice too! I definitely recommend BV.

Hidden gem IMO.  Food is always solid, though never jaw dropping.   Queso fundido is best in town, far better than Big Star, Fernando's, et al. Head across the street to the liquor store half a block north and grab a couple cold cervezas to accompany your meal.

I LOVE this place! I have been going to Buena Vista since 2004! Typically have dinner there once a week and have all of our friends and family dinners there! The food is authentic and the owners are marvelous, they are so nice every time we come in! Prices are FANTASTIC!

I love this place. Every time I've been here, the food has been fantastic. I just had their chicken quesadillas, and their ratios of meat to cheese to spices are on point. It's a hole in the wall style of restaurant, but don't let that deter you. I normally go for takeout, but there's always a bunch of people dining in. The staff is friendly and the food is kick-ass. Highly recommended for great Mexican food!
I absolutely love Buena Vista. Their delivery is super fast and accurate. I love their enchiladas and guacamole. The interior is smaller with a fun vibe. Great for a fun BYOB date.
I love this place! Fantastic authentic Mexican food, reasonably priced, BYOB, and awesome family that own and run the restaurant!

This place is my everything.  -BYOB -Cheap -Family-owned -Speedy service I live right around the corner and I go to this place way too often. It's always the same staff working, and it's the family that runs the place. You get free chips & salsa, it's BYOB, and they are super quick to get your food out of the kitchen. I'm a big fan of the Pastor burrito or the enchiladas suizas. During the summer, they have outdoor seating on the sidewalk on Broadway, which makes for a great ambiance.

I just moved to the neighborhood and we were craving late night Mexican food! This definitely satisfied us! The mole sauce was very rich in flavor! The red sauce is very spicy and hot. The steak is very very well seasoned. We were impressed! Definitely coming back again!

Food would definitely be a five star. The mole sauce was excellent, and the beans were very good. Definitely top notch Mexican food. Lost a star due to the service. Very slow-- we were pretty much ignored for most of the meal, and there was only one other customer. At the end we did talk to another gentleman and he was very nice and professional.  The chicken burrito with mole was excellent. So are their salsas, but be warned that they're pretty spicy. Enchiladas were okay and surprisingly spicy.

A small little BYOB right along Broadway in the midst of trendy and often overpriced bars, restaurants and brewers, Buena Vista manages to stay alive because it doesn't try to do more than it's capable of. Imagine a world in which Mexican food is cooked by Mexicans and meal prices still hover below $10.  If that's ideal then this is your spot.  Guac is solid, enchiladas are solid, steak chimichanga surprisingly good. Then of course it's BYO for the win and no corkage fee.  Sit indoors, sit outdoors, winner winner chicken dinner.  Literally chicken dinner.

great mole sauce, refried beans and chips and salsas. Service needs improvement. For the vegetable burrito, I've never experienced a plethora of steam fresh vegetables! The ingredients should be typical mexican ingredients: beans, lettuce, avocado, tomato, sour cream and cheese.

Buena Vista is everything a Mexican BYOB should be, in my opinion. My friends and I went here after seeing  good reviews. The dining room is small and well designed, with a few outdoor tables, nothing too fancy. Service is quick and attentive; there was no hesitation to accommodate the tequila we brought with lime wedges and empty glasses. The place is very sanitary and you actually get to walk through the kitchen on the way to the bathroom,  something I appreciate. Most importantly,  the mole sauce is exceptional. I ordered the enchiladas with mole, very rich and delicious, almost as good as mom's. Go here with friends, family or take a date and sit outside, you won't be disappointed with the very affordable food mixed with the fact you can bring your own drinks and avoid paying an arm and a leg for your favorite cocktail, wine, champagne, beer or spirit.

One of the worst Mexican Restaurants I've ever been to. Our food took over 25 minutes to arrive, when it did it was terrible. My Chorizo was underdone, and as a result, very runny. My beans were clearly burnt, my steak was bland. My brother's order came back wrong (asked for no tomato), and when he asked the waitress she believed the burrito was not supposed to have sour cream, yet it was still overflowing with it.  My other friend's order came back tasting of soap. Even the salsas that came as an appetizer were extremely watery, and tasted of nothing but salt and onions.  As a Mexican American, I'm offended that this restaurant claims to be Authentic.  The one good thing I have to say about this restaurant is that it had a nice environment, the music was nice, the lighting gave it a home like feeling; such a shame the food didn't live up to it.
YUM! This restaurant is right by my apartment and I eat here very often. Everything i have ordered has been amazing. The chips and salsa are great.
Great food! Quest fundido is DELICIOUS. Service is mediocre at best. The patio and the option of Byob is what gets me there!

We had a Grub Hub order.  delivery was very fast-much faster than anticipated. Chips and salsa were good.  The asada de puerco was well-flavored (but a bit fatty). Huge portion of meat. Tamales were fine.  Son loved his verde enchildas. Very good rrefried beans and rice.

To be honest, I've had better and there is definitely better. Price wise I thought it was expensive for the area.  From the outside of the front of the restaurant, I had assumed this was a formal dining experience to enter and realize it was the complete opposite.  But aesthetics aside, I was here for the food.  I ordered the steak nachos, and the meat, well I kept eating it to realize that I couldn't find any flavor in the steak or the cheese.  I ordered enchiladas and couldn't visualize or make sense of what I was eating as well.  The beans and rice were definitely on the 'meh' end of the flavor spectrum.  For what other's had said here, I had to "purchase" the chips and salsa.  It's typical mexican fare with any any flare for taste.  I'm sure they're nice folks behind the counter, but seriously folks, until they ramp up with ingredients and flavors, I would stay away and spend your money elsewhere.

A favorite.  My husband and I have eaten here MANY times.  The food is consistently good.  Generous portions, reliable service and casual atmosphere.  It's comfort food.  Highly recommend the  enchildas verdes with chicken!
Very sweet woman was running the restaurant when we came in at 9pm. Authentic Mexican food in a quaint setting. Steak tacos were amazing.

I LOVE this food. Everything I have ordered off the menu is spot on every time. And their food is extra spicy, which I love.  I recently moved to Chicago from Southern California, so I am absolutely addicted to Mexican food. It took months to find something close to what I can find at home, and this is it!  Good service, good menu, plus a cute little location!

My niece and I visited after our escapades to comic book stores on FCBD. We enjoyed the food, the service was perfect, and to top it all off we accidentally left a bag filled with comic books that we'd just purchased on one of the chairs and we remembered when we were blocks away, when we realized our mistake we called and asked about it and we were told that upon cleaning our table our waitress found it and was holding it for us. YAY! We were so happy. Thanks Buena Vista!
Fantastic, affordable Mexican. Great for families. My 8 month year old boy loves this place. BYOB!

Buena Vista had everything I wanted to order, WAY cheaper than any other Mexican restaurant I was looking at, and the quality of the food was superb! I got the taco salad and the fried ice cream delivered to me, the delivery took like 15 minutes, and the food was still warm and perfectly wrapped and in tact, which was impressive for what I ordered! I was very nervous ordering taco salad and fried ice cream to be delivered, but I cannot believe how good the quality of the food was for so cheap! I love Mexican food and I would HIGHLY recommend this restaurant!!! I wish I could give them 10 stars!!!!

Not bad. Definitely not expected to be extremely high end, but everything is tasty, the service is quick, and it is easy on the wallet.  If you are looking for some casual, quick, Mexican food, come check it out.
Very fast take out service. I love the ground beef enchiladas because they cook the beef with carrots and potatoes and bay leaf.
solid fare, convenient. low key.

A favorite neighborhood joint. Delicious food and decent prices. BYOB. I've had their chicken taco dinner and it was sooo good and filling. The horchata is also very good. Smallish space, so it might not be the best for a larger group. The service is nice and friendly.

Traditional Mexican food. If you are in need for a good delicious meal, this is a place to go. It's a tiny book with just a handful of tables but the food is authentic. Their salsas are perfect. A red mild and a green with a spicy kick to it. We had brunch here which was great. No alcohol is a minus but am sure they won't mind if you byob.
Really delicious food at a reasonable price. Very friendly staff as well! Overall a great experience.

Chicken mole burrito, y'all.  It is one of the best things in this 'hood.   Packed with your choice of meat (chicken is my fav!), rice and their amazing mole - just fantastic.  Also, their hot sauce?  Make sure you ask for both the green and red because you will definitely be sad when you run outta it.  So good.  For around $6, you will be so full and satisfied.   The restaurant is generally busy (there's a handful of tables inside), but in the nicer-weather months, the little patio opens up and people watching is always great.  Oh, and BYOB.  Win all around!
Good food, even better prices. The staff is friendly and incredibly fast and efficient- my food arrived in 9 minutes!! Its BYOB makes it all a sweeter deal.

Mom, ma...are you in the back of the kitchen...The dark mole tasted pretty close to hers which is a rarity! Not many Mexican places make the dark chocolaty mole for enchiladas....its usually red or the verde (green).  Had to try the pollo con mole and I was very pleased! The chicken was very tender, fell right off the bone and the mole was plentiful, every bite had the mole dripping off the fork.  I didn't care for the sesame seeds on top of the chicken and mole (isn't that an Asian thing?) I wish they had chopped onions and queso fresco sprinkled over the dish.  My date had chicken and steak tacos and she really enjoyed them as well and were loaded with delicious flavors!   I love when Mexican places have refried beans that are not dry and taste like paste. Every Mexican loves their beans and has to have them at some point during the day! It was a relief to have the beans moist and flavorful.  I really enjoyed the rice too.  Some places have mushy rice or not enough tomato sauce in the rice...this place had it right! The salsa and chips were delicious! I LOVE  when the salsas (red and green) and chips are not overly salty!   The service was OK.  Took the waiter quite some time to bring out chips and salsa when we first sat down and glasses for our BYOB of Sangria.  Never really came and checked on our water for refills.  They were not busy, there was another couple and a table of 4 occupied, so I was pretty surprised as to why it took so long.   All in all I did like the food, the dark mole was such a treat! It was cozy and great to sit drink the alcohol of our choice.  Que rico! Hasta Luego!

Excellent, casual Mexican! BYOB and great service and food. This place is always packed on a Friday night so get there early. Their guac is a great appetizer, as is the shrimp cocktail. Fajitas are my go to main dish- and boy are they delicious! Highly recommend everything on the menu!

Great service! Very friendly and accommodating staff. Now the food, excellent and very authentic, if you're in the mood for mexican food and in the area I highly recommend it! Try the golden Cadillac margarita to start.

Finally found a spot for good Mexican food in the neighborhood and an added bonus is that their prices are very reasonable!  We first started out with salsa and chips and the salsa definitely exceeded any expectations I had. I'm pretty sure the salsa was homemade. We then ordered the queso fundito as an appetizer and there was a perfect balance between the gooey cheese and the juicy chorizo.  I ordered a burrito for my entree which had steak and cheese. Very good and they don't overdo the cheese like some other places do. Loved the BYOB aspect. Definitely will be coming back here again.

It is a great little place but no where I would drive out of my way for. The queso is amazing!! They do an amazing job with it. I ordered the tacos with steak and ground beef. The ground beef was so salty I couldn't eat it and the steak was chewy. The service was slow as well. It's not somewhere I will repeat if helped.

This is quite a small restaurant but the food they make is incredible and it is a steal at their prices plus they are BYOB. We ordered the queso fundito and the guacamole as an appetizer and both come in deep fried tortillas shaped into a bowl, it was pretty cool. We opted to get the chroizo with the queso fundito and it was worth it. For my main course I had to go with the tamale platter because I can never pass up a tamale. It was good and definitely the right choice. Bonus: both their red and green salsas are quite good and go well with not only the chips but basically all the food they serve. Bonus #2: there is a liquor store VERY close by, within eye sight from their front door.

Made my second visit to Buena Vista last Thursday...still a solid player.  Tried the queso fundido and the al pastor burrito this time around...plus some guac, we dropped $15/person (that was tax and tip) and I left very, almost uncomfortably full.  If you show up solo and do take out, you should definitely be able to feed yourself for under $10/person.  Love the small space, the service is pretty fast, and they are BYO.  Simple menu but good execution on the classics and the value/price point is spot on!
Great food!  Service is meh, you have to ask twice for things but the food is great and I'll be back!
Really good and inexpensive BYOB Mexican food. They do take out as well and have some outdoor seating during the summer. The mole dishes are particularly good.

We have lived in Chicago for a little over a year and have probably tried every Mexican restaurant within 10 miles of our house. We still can't find one that we would want to go back to and this is no exception. It's good not great. Cheap and BYOB so we could be back- but not bc the food is over the top delicious.

Add me to the list of people who think this little place offers a lot of food for a low price, but nothing remarkable. Service was very prompt and everything my wife and I ordered seemed fresh. We agreed that the horchata (rice drink) was delicious. Our burritos were uninspired but filling.  Rice and beans were good.  My "supreme" had lots of steak but so little sour cream it couldn't be seen or tasted.  In fact, the spices were overwhelming, so there was only one flavor.  I like spicy food, but not if it obliterates the individual items in the meal. There are so many really good Mexican restaurants in the area, we won't be back anytime soon.

This place does NOT have the best burritos in Chicago.  They probably aren't even the best burritos on the block. To quote a culinary companion, "It was the most uninspired and anflavorful al pastor burrito I've ever eaten."

Nothing to complain about here. Mexican food is solid, nothing to blow your mind, but great for the price. We were able to sit outside easily on a busy Friday night. BYOB with no corking fee etc. Service was really nice and fast. Check it out, you shouldn't be disappointed.

We stopped in on a recent Saturday night and had an amazing meal.  The food was very fresh and flavourful.  And the price couldn't be beat.  The portions are large, with great flavour and the fact that it's bring your own makes it a great find.

I just had dinner there tonight and it was great! My friend and I wanted to do BYOB and have Mexican food and I choose this place because of the great reviews that this restaurant has gotten on Yelp. I'm so glad that I decided to try this place...the food was top notch and the staff was so attentive!!! I will definitely be back. The only reason that I gave this place 4/5 stars is because I want to make sure that the service and food are as good next time as they were this time!

Solid 4.  The food was delicious, as were the chips and salsa!  We loved the chicken fajitas and carne asada steak.  BYOB was great.  The service was friendly, and the ambiance was a gentle roar, perfect for a saturday night in an intimate little place.  Will definitely be back!

Buena Vista can only be called delicious. As my boyfriend and I were eating dinner, he said to me, "this could be some of the best Mexican food I've ever had." The service was great and our waters were always full.  I'd recommend the mole sauce with anything they are putting it on. The chicken was marinated and cooked perfectly so I would recommend that as well.   The place is small and BYOB, so if you go, bring a drink (they do not even serve alcoholic beverages) and expect to have an amazing meal!

Excellent food, service, and price. I'm from Southern California, where poor Mexican restaurants die very quickly and have sampled a number of Mexican places around here, trying to find an inexpensive but tasty place--this fits the bill. Had the chicken enchiladas suiazas--excellent. The beans and rice were nothing special, but good. The complementary salsas (green and red) and chips were a great start--tasty, spicy salsa, and fresh tortilla chips. Very happy to have stopped in here, and I'll be back. :)
I love that place. Food is great. Owners are friendly. BYOB. Will be back.

I'm kind of shocked at some dumpy reviews I've seen. I've been coming here for years, and I've always been greeted with great food, service and value. I see people comparing Buena to Tarascas, and while it's true they both specialize in Mexican food, they shouldn't be used as examples to one another. If you're expectation is to walk into a large dining room with flowing Margaritas and a Mariachi bad, you won't like BV. If you want a small sit-down, that's BYOB, laid back and delicious food? This is the place. Lastly, the value is outstanding. 2 people can have a great dinner for less that $25. Try the mini-chimi's.

We tried: Posole and the enchiladas. Two of my favorite Mexican  dishes. First, the Posole. I had it with the red chili. I'I search over and over for Posole like my mom used to make...thought it was better than most that I've tried outside of Northern New Mexico.  but it feel short in the flavor department the pork was a bit chewy and maybe the next day it would be better as with most soups.  I opted for the ground beef in the enchiladas. The tortilla disintegrated with the use of my fork. I'm not sure if it was even a corn tortilla. (Which is typically what is used) instead of the flour tortilla. In any case,  again, you'd think with all those things in one bite you'd have lots of flavor?  The beef was also a weird texture..as in no texture?  When I ordered,  I asked the owner if they made their own flour tortillas? He kinda laughed like yeah right..(like who would ever do that?) Oh and they don't make their own chips either. I didn't think that their guac or their sauces were anything special. (I actually think Chipotle's guac and red hot sauce are way better than this place) Go figure.. I can't see me going back for this bland food.
Incredibly average mexican food. I prefer Tarascas down the street...

I love this place for both delivery and dining in. I love that it's BYOB and I can't tell you how fast the delivery is. I have never waiting over 40 minutes most I the time it's as fast as 25-30 minutes even on a Saturday. I have tried everything from the queso fundido to the fajitas you just can't go wrong. Make sure of you like queso that this is the kind that is made from chihuahua cheese so it won't be the consistency of a nacho queso cheese but I love it so much. Only down side is the actual restaurant is a little small so harder for bigger groups but perfect for couples or foursomes.

This is our go-to Mexican place in Lakeview. It is very small (maybe 8 tables) and reasonably priced. It is also BYOB and conveniently located across the street from a  liquor store.  Husband and I get the steak chimichangas and the queso fundido with chorizo and split them. The queso fundido comes in a taco shell bowl and is the best I've ever had. The service can be sometimes lacking, but for the price, you can't beat this place.

This place gets 5 stars for its value.  If you are looking for the very best mexican food in chicago, then you may need to hit up a few other places.  However, Buena Vista has really good food and it is super cheap.  They have very attentive and fast service.  Plus, its a small cozy place.  A must try on the north side.
Buena Vista tiene los mejores tacos al pastor de la Vista al Lago!!  The pork tamales are also great at this charming little family-run restaurant.  Highly recommended!

My boyfriend and I were walking down Broadway in search of a place to eat before biking over to a movie at the Landmark. I was fading fast, and at that point where nothing was piquing my interest even though I desperately needed food. We saw Buena Vista and its BYOB sign, so we sidestepped over to the liquor store across the street, grabbed 2 big bottles of beer, and crossed Broadway once again for some Mexican. It was so good! And very fast! Everything was fresh and tasty, and the pastor taco was especially delicious. I definitely recommend this solid Mexican restaurant :-)

This place is great.  Order from here all the time and never disappointed.  Their refried beans are the best, as is the enchiladas with mole sauce.  For the price, there is not a better deal in Chicago.

Saw the great reviews and decided to try Buena Vista for take out twice. I was a big fan of their chips and salsa, the salsa was spicy and delicious, but I didn't like the fact that you had to pay for it.  My real gripe here is with the main courses. I had three tacos, Steak, Pastor and Chorizo. Their chorizo was god awful. Usually chorizo tastes more or less the same across all mexican restaurants but theirs had a weird, rather off putting flavor. I almost didn't bother finishing that taco. The other two were decent, but nothing amazing. Maybe I just ordered the wrong thing, but for Mexican, I've yet to find a real good place around lakeview.
I just love this place. It's cheap and really good and byob. Family owned and they are so attentive. Just love it for the amount u pay.

I'm a big fan of the number of BYOBs located in our neighborhood. However, Buena Vista is one of our favorites, and easily the one we've been to the most.  I love that it's BOYB and the service is normally spot-on. Our food is always served quickly and hot. and they're super quick to bring you out some wine glasses and a bottle opener once you're seated. I almost always get the enchiladas, and it's enough food that I can split it into two meals. Would love to come back some time when it's actually nice enough to sit outside!

Probably the most hit or miss restaurant Ive ever tried. Seems to me they have one or two problem cooks that just dont give a shit... Since they are consistently inconsistent, I avoid this place; consistently.

This place has gone downhill. My husband and I used to love this place while we lived in Lakeview - freshest, cheapest Mexican food ever - and then we moved out of the city. So returning two years later I was incredibly disappointed.  This return visit, I got the veggie burrito; my husband got the beef burrito, both with mole sauce.  My husband liked his, but mine was awful. I see now that other Yelpers have had exactly the same reaction. Peas, carrots, green beans and potato in a veggie burrito?! Are real vegetables too hard (I don't know.. red peppers, onions, tomatoes..?)  They were clearly frozen vegetables. The mole sauce was fine but not evenly distributed throughout the burrito which made it totally overwhelming in some bites, and nonexistent in others.  So sad to me, but we won't come back again.

This place was highly recommended by Yelp as a great place to get Mexican in Lakeview. I was disappointed. Yes the chips and salsa were great, the rice and beans were not so bad but my food...not so much in my opinion. My boyfriend ordered the tampiquena and it looked pretty good and he seemed to enjoy it. I ordered the taco and tostada combo, I had a ground beef taco and chorizo tostada, which to me is a mexican staple and should not be too difficult to get right. But i was wrong, the ground beef was to chewy and not very flavorful, while the chorizo was too sweet and almost fake tasting. The service was pretty good and it seemed pretty busy so I might come back but I will definitely order something different.

To be honest I'm kind of shocked at how well this place is reviewed! I went here last week in a "we're bored, let's try something new in our abundant neighborhood" kind of mood and I was really disappointed. I had a veggie burrito and my sister had the chicken burrito, and we shared a side order of guacamole. Let's start with the good: the salsa and guac were both out of this world. Some of the freshest I've had, although the guac was a little too not-spicy for my taste. We went in early evening and were one of two tables filled, so service was decent. Not quite as attentive as I expected, but I'm easy to please. The bad: everything else! They use what I'm guessing is a mole sauce rice for inside the burrito, which totally throws off the flavor of everything else inside of it. It was entirely too sweet. The vegetables in my veggie burrito? Potatoes, green peas, and carrots. It was so bizarre and did not work at all flavor-wise. There was only a tiny bit of sour cream and lettuce inside of it, and the waiter never checked to see how everything was, he just brought the check. I hardly made it through half of it and devoted the rest of my stomach to the guac. My sister's chicken burrito didn't seem much better. It was soaked and soggy with the amount of meat in it, and she did not like the sweet rice either. Unfortunately, I think I'll stick to Chipotle when I'm in the mood for a burrito in this area.

It looks like we've found our new go-to place for Mexican food in Lakeview. I'm moving back to Lakeview soon, and I can see myself coming here a lot more often. The best thing about Buena Vista? They serve one of my favorite Mexican soups: Pozole. While their pozole isn't nearly as good as El Norte (now closed on Bryn Mawr and Broadway), I like Buena Vista's version more than some other places I've tried. It's a bit bland though so I had to add more salt to it. This is still better than overly salted so I'm okay with it. The meat is very tender, and the hominy was cooked perfectly.  My favorite dish at Buena Vista though, is their asado de puerco. The rice was perfectly cooked. I love that the texture of the rice wasn't too soft nor was it crunchy. The beans tasted fresh as well. The star of this dish was the pork, which was tenderly cooked in a red sauce with hints of chipotle. I almost wanted to take some of this pork and put in my pozole to give it more flavor to my soup.  They're also a BYOB place, and I read that they do delivery.
quick, cheap and decent mexican food.

Quick, cheap, and good mexican food! It's not the biggest or flashiest restaurant, but Buena Vista serves some quality food with good service. No wait, BYOB, cheap, and the food is great. Tons of options to choose from and everything tasted wonderful. The service was friendly and the atmosphere is pretty cool. It's not a very big restaurant but they have some cool art and overall just a cool vibe. It's a fun place to grab lunch or a casual dinner. Not a great place if you are trying to be fancy, but otherwise a fantastic choice. Atmosphere: 8/10 Service: 8/10 Food: 8.5/10
Solid Mexican joint!  Nothing fancy but good food, great service, and BYOB.  Only reason I don't give it 5 stars is because I'm not crazy about their salsas.

I love the steak taco dinner.  The beans and rice are the best I've ever had.  The salsa rojo is fantastico!  PLUS, as many free chips and salsa as you can eat.  Add in BYOB and outdoor seating in the summer, and you've got one awesome, affordable casual Mexican standby!

I've ordered delivery from this place at least 10 times, and if anything they're reliable - they've never messed up an order.  But consistent?  I've ordered in the afternoon, the middle of the evening, and late at night, and I'd have better luck predicting how good it's going to be by reading the delivery guy's palm. I've received overstuffed salads exploding with gorgeous grilled chicken and avocados, delicately fried flautas and tasty, crispy chimichangas. I've also been handed salads where the green lettuce is turning red and the chicken is still close to pink.  I've paid for burnt chilaquiles, burnt chimichangas, and not-burnt-enough quesadillas (you know, when the cheese is still gummy?). The important thing is they're often great, occasionally at their best, and once in a while at their worst.  And even their worst isn't that bad. But stay away from the steak, in general.  Their chorizo is moist and spicy.  Their steak  is usually so gristly and elastic that you could use it for resistance the next time you work out.

This is my favorite Mexican place in Chicago.  For starters, just the chips and salsa they put out on the table are fantastic.  Then, all of the entrees are beyond excellent.  I cannot recommend the burrito with mole sauce more.  Like, stop reading, and go get it.  Dat mole. Ok, your back?  Good.  Now that you have your plate in front of you, try those refried beans.  Amazing, right?  I swear, my girlfriend comes, loves the amazing entrees, but deep down knows all she wants are their beans. Oh, and it's BYOB, so that's a thing. Only problem is the food I've already had here is so good, I have a hard time trying new things that I'm sure I'll love just as much.

What a breath of fresh air.  My wife and I just moved from Oak Park, so this may be a little premature for the five stars, but we were very happy.  Great service with a smile, delicious authentic Mexican food, multiple staff members helping out at all times, and best of all it's BYOB.  They've just made some loyal gringo eaters! Muchas Gracias BV!
Cheapest, bestest, BYOBest restaurant around. Love, love, love Buena Vista.

Love love love!!! The owners are wonderful! You walk in and it feels like I'm in my mothers kitchen having a family dinner. Not only is the atmosphere great but the food never fails to be anything less then delicious! I've been coming here for 7yrs!

Came here recently for quick dinner and loved it! It's pretty small and very simple, so don't expect anything crazy fancy. Delicious food-- cheesy enchiladas, great quesadillas and awesome rice/beans/drinks! BYOB tops it off to be perfect.
Coming from Texas, this is truly a delightful place to stumble upon. I was missing Mexican food...I would even settle for Tex Mex. After coming here, my cravings are settled!

I've definitely experienced better! Was here with a group of 6 people for dinner. Its great that they take reservations and are BYOB. The spicy tomatillo salsa is one of the best I've ever had. Our table got chips with guac, chiles rellenos, veggie tacos, enchiladas, burrito and camrones in garlic sauce. Nothing was bad but nothing blew me away either. Its your average mexican joint that serves decent food.

Wow!! I don't know what it is.. But my gf and I have had the luckiest streak for coming to 5 star restaurants that we have agreed upon. As for Buena Vista, it has gone to our #1 spot for our favorite Mexican restaurant in the state of Illinois! It's a small place, but there's nothing wrong with that. It has tables for couples and medium size groups up to 8 maybe.. They had a reserved sign on their table. We were very lucky to get the last couple table. It was jam packed. It's clean and well kept. I'm assuming it's a family owned restaurant.. But anyway, that's besides the point. The staff is well mannered and nice. If you're a douche bag and/or a snob, don't bother coming here. Go down the street to Chipotle you loser.  The food.. PURE BLISS! They start you with warm chips and your choice of red (spicy) and green (spicier) salsa lol. I had the steak burrito supreme with rice, lettuce, tomatoes, and MOLE sauce! YUM!! That sauce is what made the burrito so flavorful. My gf (she's an original Cali chick) says the food reminded her of home. And if you've ever been to Cali, there's like a Mexican restaurant on every block out there LoL. She had the two al pastor tacos dinner with beans and rice. She spoke through her facial reaction. If you've ever watched the movie Lilo & Stitch, and Stitch made that excited look when he was about to eat something.. that's what she looked like. Hahaha!  What a wonderful experience we had here!!!

Ive been here like four times already.  I like that its not a chain restaurant and the food... o my the food.  you'd think that the tacos wouldnt taste so great since they're the cheapest meal on the menu.. WRONG.  i dont remember what else ive had but between my bf and i, we've tried the whole menu already adn will keep comin back.  def a favorite/

Delicious salsa! There is no corkage fee, and the service is good and quick. We went on a Tuesday night, there were lots of people getting to-go food, but nobody else sitting. Food was tasty and very inexpensive. The a la carte menu on the back is great.... you can order a couple tacos for less than $2 each and they are pretty big. Everyone cleaned their plates and the entire tab was less than $30 for 5 people, great deal for the amount of food we got! I will be going back.
This place is fantastic! I'm not exactly sure what it is but great food at great prices is always a good place to start. Everything I have had here has been great. BYOB
Delicious, cheap Mexican food!! One of my favorite places in the city.

You want good, cheap food in Lake View East? You've come to the right place.. I like to support local places, and this is my new go to place for Mexican.  I usually stick with the various enchiladas, although all the food seems to be very well prepared. It is BYOB, I don't think they charge any extra.

Absolutely outstanding. Freshly fried chips with red and green salsa to start, beautifully arranged entrees, and a very hard working staff that made the visit memorable. The food was delicious and the space is cozy and energetic. Prices seem almost too good to be true. A great find on a street with plenty of options.

I just went for the first time on a weekday at lunch time.  It's very small, but was nearly empty.  Most of their business is likely carryout and delivery.  The place is clean, it seemed like the manager himself greeted me when I walked in, and my order was taken right away.  I ordered the tostada dinner with pork and it took less than five minutes before it was in front of me.  Chips and salsa are put on the table free and are good quality.  The portion is very big, everything is fresh, colorful, crisp and clean, with no sign of greasiness at all.  I would have liked more seasoning from the al pastor, as I've previously had it a bit spicy and with sauteed onions.  Still, everything was tasty, it only cost $7.50 and I was full by the end.  I'll definitely be back to try a burrito.

The Burrito Supreme is the best burrito I have had in my entire life!!! And the salsa here, OMG. It doesn't get any better. I used to be able to walk here any old day I wanted... but at least they deliver to my new place!!!  I always get the Burrito Supreme w/ Vegetables and haven't bothered to try anything else because it is so delicious. BEST MEXICAN JOINT IN THE CITY.

If cheap volumous mexican food is your thing, then this is the palce for you. There is absolutely nothing wrong with this place. Its pretty clean, serves pretty decent food, is fairly friendly and is BYOB. The portions are huge (I have to guess that their burritos are a couple of pounds...) and the prices are very good. But in my opinion, you have to take a look around and figure out what you are competing with. Buena Vista is at the Chipotle (which is just down the street) price point and has a very similar level of quality food (Chipotle probably has better meat but worse everything else). This is not an easy market to excel in with such a powerhouse competitor, but as a consumer the question you need to ask yourself is "do I support local businesses or not?".

Good cheap Mexican food. Very impressive servings for the price. Mole is excellent. Multi layer, dark, chocolate, smoke flavor. Fast service. If you want a combo, just pick what you want and they will plate it together from you. Chips were good, warm and not greasy.Green and Red Sauces were good.

What a great place, coming from California, I know good Mexican food when I see it. This definitely qualifies. I ordered the Steak beans and rice burrito. It was cooked to perfection, I come here about 3 times a week. The owner is very nice, very friendly staff. Very cheap too. Dine in only was 6.10 for chips and salsa, water and a burrito.  Come to this fine establishment and you will not be disappointed.
Incredible food for a fantastic price. BYOB with a liquor store across the street. Try the Fajitas.

Easy place to go on a weekday night for a quick meal. Byob, they have glasses but I don't know if there's any fee. Probably not. Cheap dinner- get the mole enchiladas. The mole is great. They also do takeout and have a small outdoor eating area.

You can't beat the Burrito Supreme -- for $6, you get a humongous burrito stuffed with steak, vegetables, rice, mole sauce, cheese, lettuce, tomato, and sour cream! Someone could easily make this giant burrito into three meals. Ask for salsas too! Also pick up a few pork tamales and a horchata drink, and you're good to go!

After a long day of moving to my new apartment, my boyfriend was craving some good quality Mexican food. We had walk by this place multiple times before but we've just never stopped in before. I am so glad that we did. My boyfriend didn't talk the entire time because he was too busy shoveling food into his mouth. I got the chicken enchilada and he got the steak enchilada. Both were SO GOOD. The chicken enchilada simply melted in my mouth. I couldn't stop eating it even though I was stuffed. The fact that this place was some of the best Mexican I have ever had and was so cheap made it a place that we will be coming back to over and over again.

I am so full, OF DELICIOUS ENCHILADAS DE POLLO CON MOLE. (chicken was much better than ground beef) I have walked by this store front a hundred times and not until tonight did I experience its tasty, cheap food thanks to a quick Yelp search. Perfect spot for BYOB and/or Mondays when many other restaurants are closed.

Best salsa in the city! My new favorite Mexican restaurant in Chicago. Awesome service, the place is very small just a handful of tables. Beautiful decor. Chicken enchiladas de mole was perfect as was the shrimp fajita platter. The best mole sauce I've had, tons of flavor. I recently decided that i wouldn't visit a restaurant twice in an attempt to diversify my palate but I'm making an exception now, I'll be back here many times!

I didn't realize how good Buena Vista was until I went to some of the other BYOB Mexican places in Lakeview/Wrigleyville. Sure, there is better Mexican food in the city. But if you're near Broadway and Belmont, there is nothing cheaper, better, or more convenient than Buena Vista. The mole is solid, and the chilaquiles are the perfect way to soak up a hangover. There's a liquor store literally right across the street where you can get a family-sized Corona or a bottle of wine before grabbing a table. There are even a few tables outside in the summer. ¿Qué más quieres?

This is a solid 3 star mexican restaurant. Very cheap and quite tasty food. Everything you are familiar with at a typical mexican place makes an appearance here. The only reason I didn't give it more stars is because it's a pretty basic restaurant. Nothing was mind blowingly awesome. One main gripe I have is the fact that this place is really small. The small place makes the noise level go up a little too much in my opinion. Everyone was screaming at each other to talk the night i went.

what a great BYOB Mexican restaurant.  I have walked by this place many times over the past 2 years living in Lakeview, but just recently came here with a couple friends.  The staff is so friendly and accommodating, the chips and salsa were excellent.  The food is pretty good and great portions.  It is small, so sometimes there is a wait for a table, but it is well worth it.  Great place to come with a few friends and have a great dinner!!

Delicious and cheap, what more can you ask for? The pork tamales were so delicious! The food is very filling. I ordered 2 tacos and 2 pork tamales and in truth, 1 of each would be sufficient for me. The horchata was ridiculous palatable! Once I started drinking it,  I couldn't not stop until I reach the bottom of the glass. Next time, I am ordering two horchatas!

GOOD, CHEAP, BYOB!!!!!  This place gets it done. Good food at a good price, and you can't beat BYOB!!! This is the first place I think of when I am craving Mexican food and a beer or two, want to stay close and keep my pocketbook in check.  Atmosphere is quaint and humble. Perfect place to go with a few friends or a date to have a relaxing dinner and convo.

Oh-My-God I love you Buena Vista I have recently had to go on dietary restrictions (no gluten, low nickel) and Buena Vista is one of the few Mexican places that is able to accomodate me without making me pay full price for half the amount of food. Gluten free: Their corn tortillas!  So green light on the tacos, enchiladas, and quesadillas.
Nice heat to the red salsa; green was very mild. Wonderful queso fundito and chorizo. Nice waitress and no cork fee!

I have searched high and low, but no place does a better al pastor taco. I craze it every time I'm back in Chicago for a visit. They are so good! This place is very clean and has nice, simple decor. The service is usually pretty good (a bit slow this time) and you can get a great meal for very little. Love this place!
Really solid food, reasonably priced, tasty al pastor, big tortas. Worth a shot if you're in the area.

Very good mexican food! 2 different types of salsas, both very good. Our dishes were very good and good priced. Got the Chicken Flautas, friend got the steak fajitas and boyfriend got the enchiladas with verde sauce. All very good! We got the fried ice cream and it was perfect for 3 to share. Only $3! It's also BYOB. Downfall is the size :/. Wish it were bigger

I have been here a couple times; its near my house.  Its a small place, but cozy and intimate.  You can also get your food to go. The portions are huge and very reasonably priced.  I have been able to eat each time under $10 with a lot of great food.  Sure, Mexican places are all over, but the setting here is a little different.  Waiter service, nice patio, cool art.  A nice place to relax, chill and have a great bite to eat!

I think that people are pretty spot on with the 3 and 4 star reviews.   I had the steak burrito and steak tacos, with Mole, and they were pretty good.  Nothing to write home about, until you get a the bill.  For two full meals, decent tamales, and free chips and salsa our bill for two was under $20.  Can't really beat that.   Admittedly, the mole enchiladas with ground beef were pretty blase.  I think this is one place that you need to pick and choose the good stuff off the menu and stay away the less appealing items.  Of course, this requires going there and figuring out what the less appealing items are.  But since it's so cheap, and you now know that that you can get a high quality steak taco meal, there isn't too much risk.   In a sentence: pretty good Mexican food at a great price in a pricey neighborhood.

Buena Vista is an austere, bare bones, BYOB little Mexican joint on Broadway.  I searched the Yelp one day to find a place to eat over on what's almost become my new stomping grounds (the Mecca known as Lakeview) and came up with Buena Vista since it's in one of the four food categories - pasta, burgers, pizza and Mexican.   Buena Vista has the usual Mexican specialties and the usual chips and salsa.  I can't say I was a fan of the green or red salsas, but I did bear with them.  Green sauce of any kind is going to turn me off.   The tacos at Buena Vista were okay.  Were they four-star caliber?  I don't think so.  I'd put them on par with or maybe a smidge above Nueva's tacos.  About the only difference between the two places is that you get the chintzy decor and alcohol at Nueva.   I think I preferred one or two of the tacos at Taco Joint to the ones at Buena Vista.  I guess I'm just not very authentico.  Mang. Three stars.

I had the steak burrito suizo with mole sauce and chips and guacamole on Sunday, June 19, 2011. The next day I woke up with nausea and food poisoning symptoms. The symptoms lasted two days. I have never had food poisoning in my life, and I have eaten at various places around the world where the handling of meat and dairy products are questionable compared to American standards.  I thought the food was just okay. Their guacamole was nothing to write high praises about, very average. The steak burrito, mole sauce, re-fried beans and rice was average as well.  I would have gone back to tame down a Mexican food craving, but since I got food poisoning, I will not go back. However, don't let my experience spoil it for others if the location is convenient. My predecessors seemed to have no enter-gastritis problems after visiting this establishment.  They seem to deliver, and the place is BYOB, which are huge bonuses. The restaurant is very small with very limited seating.
Incredible food, fair prices, in a hip neighborhood, cozy environment. Also great for vegetarians.

Started out with free chips and 2 salsas.  No AC so the place was pretty warm even with the front door propped open.  Said they were going to set up a patio soon though. The food was average.  Nothing really wowed me but it was good.  Had the chile rellenos, pork tamales, steak burrito, chicken mole, and guacamole.  No, not all by myself, but I did taste it all.

So three stars may not be saying enough about Buena Vista, but for my first visit I wasn't overly impressed. Love that it's BYOB and around the corner, but the service was a little lacking and it's only ten tables! I took the other Yelper suggestions and ordered something with the Mole sauce, but I wish I would have ordered Tacos al pastor.  The portions are huge, the mole sauce is actually quite spicy but the rice has corn, peas and carrots in it. Not my personal fave.  I will try again because it's so close, maybe a better experience next time!

The Answer: Buena Vista, Enchiladas Mole The Question: "if you had to choose your last meal before moving out of Lakeview, what would it be?" Has been a steady go-to for some time. Always quick and good for eat-in and take out. BYOB doesn't hurt. Will definitely try to get back!

My boyfriend and I love this family owned restaurant.  Great big portions, fast and super friendly service, plus BYOB! The guac is great, the mole is killer, and I always grab a flan to go.  Excited to sit outside this summer.
great small business, I personally like how the carne asada comes with a grilled green onion. Quick, high quality food.

A solid Mexican restaurant at a great value.   I was in the neighborhood working out, and I figured why not go replenish the calories I just burned.  Well, not exactly my thoughts, but that surely was the result.  My wife and I stopped in to Buena Vista for a late dinner.  First off, the complimentary chips and salsa are great.  The salsas were truly delicious.   I decided to go a with a Chicken Burrito Suizo w/ Mole Sauce, and I am so glad that I did.  The burrito was huge as were the flavors.   The atmosphere is pretty basic, but the service was attentive and friendly.  Very good experience overall!

While Buena Vista isn't the best Mexican in the neighborhood as far as I'm concerned, it will satisfy a craving in a pinch.  The best part about it are the large portions with small price tags.  The food arrives hot and fast which is good for all the obvious reasons but also great because this place is so small people can get in and out quickly if that's what you want.  However, I don't think lingering is encouraged.  Since BV is small I had hoped it would have a homey or cozy feeling I didn't get that at all.  In fact, I didn't feel as welcomed as I was hoping and that's a little disappointing for a place like this in my neighborhood.  Maybe my expectations were too high but I feel like smaller places like this have the chance to create a welcoming atmosphere and I just didn't get that.  But the food was decent, cheap and fast.  And if that's what I'm looking for in the future I'd probably stop back in but take my food to go.

A brief review. . . when you're in the neighborhood and you just gotta have it, this is the place to go. Picture this: a sunny, cold afternoon; an empty restauant, save for one waiter; and a baby boomer salivating for a taste of Mexico. Since a week-long trip to Puerta Vallarta is not currently in the cards, next-best choice is something hot and greasy. So I looked at the menu and said to myself, "Self, what do you really want?" And Self said, I want something hot and messy and spicy and totally satisfying and probably verboten on the Weight Watchers plan. So Self and I ordered an appetizer- queso fundido with chorizo.  It arrived in a big bowl made of taco chips, with a side of four warm flour tortillas (my choice - didn't want corn). The cheese was hot and runny. A pile of chorizo was dribbled all over the surface, like gravel, but tastier. I took a taco chip and scooped out a hot, drippy mess. The cheese was melty and long trails of stringy cheese trailed down my chin. Oh my God, I thought - this has got to be better than cocaine could ever be. How could something so delicious be legal? I took a tortilla and dug in. It was fantastic. It was satisfying. It cleared my sinuses. Warmth spread through my chest (from the inside, that is - I didn't dribble THAT much!).  I ate all four tortillas, and made pretty good progress on the taco bowl itself. All this happened around 3pm, and I'd had nothing to eat since about 8am. After this, I didn't need or want dinner. I went home and belched spices for hours. It was wonderful. I'm so glad I did this. Sometime I will go back and eat a real meal there, or order it for delivery.
