By the way, two other women came in and checked out the menu, and ended up leaving without ordering. One of the two was a vegan. She saw nothing she could order. They went somewhere else where her dietary choices could be addressed. I eavesdropped on them while slurping cheese and chorizo. I like my choices better.

Buena Vista was the first Mexican restaurant my girlfriend and I visited after we moved here 6 months ago; our inaugural experience was truly a delight.  At glance, its quite unassuming, but this family operation always outputs great service and very tasty cuisine.   We've gotten a fair variety of the menu at this point, so I feel comfortable throwing this place a 5-star review.  Right from the get-go, the salsa was bright, bold, and not afraid of a little fire.  The steak is amazing, which cannot be said for many Mexican restaurants, and the mole sauce was super-tasty.  Their chorizo has sass, and fajitas are always sizzlin' with heat and flavor.  On top of all the vibrant tastes, the service is consistently top-notch, with our water glasses never descending below half-full and our chips and salsa being replenished beyond our capacity. If you like family-owned and operated restaurants full of heat and flavor, make this unsuspecting joint a stop on your tour of East Lakeview.

My favorite Mexican restaurant. I come at least once a month. It used to be three times a week when I lived in the area, but I still make my way up to Lakeview just to come to Buena Vista.  The owner(s) are very attentive and always warm. The free hot tortilla chips and salsa (both green and red) are outstanding, though I prefer the more-spicy red. The place is perfect for a small group and for an intimate date. Even better, come on your own with a book during the day, sit at a table by the window, watch the folks passing by, and feel lucky that you live so close to my favorite restaurant. The Enchiladas con Mole, two chicken one beef...yes please. Honestly, once I tried their mole, I couldn't stray away from this dish. Sometimes I'll order the Enchiladas con Mole, two with chicken, one Verde with beef. I like that they're able to make that happen because from my experience, most other Mexican restaurants won't.  Once piece of advice: if you're in a bit of a rush and they are very busy, ask for the check when they come to take away your plates--or just go up to the front and pay. Otherwise, it might take 20 minutes. Also, try not to fill up on the chips for your body's sake. I always leave feeling like I might diarrhea, vomit, and explode all at the same time--not from bad food, but from overeating.

I LOVE this place. Best Mexican grub in the neighborhood, by far. Super homey, nice people, great service, amazing food. I've been here numerous times with different people, and they all love it. Tacos, burritos, enchiladas, quesadillas...it's all awesome. I'd honestly feel good about trying anything on the menu. My absolute favorite thing is the tacos pastor. Juicy marinated pork with chopped onions and cilantro. Legit. If you've never heard of it or never had it, enlighten yourself. I promise it's worth it. The homemade guacamole is fantastic, and their chips and salsa are delicious (and free!) I'm actually getting hungry just thinking about it... Best part? I don't think I've ever spent even close to $10. The prices are great, and the portions are plentiful. They also have the classic Mexican bottles of coke, with real sugar. Perfect. Go here!

Came here Saturday night looking for cheap Mexican food with our beer in tow - love that it's BYOB! Very small place so we had to wait a few minutes for a table and it's a little crowded, but it's still very cute and cozy. The food was delicious - you have to order the queso funido with chorizo, I could have made a meal entirely of that.  In fact, the cheese was so filling we hardly touched our burrito, which was also great.  But it was also good reheated the next day. The service was great and everyone is very nice and friendly, this will definitely be a regular place for us!
Buena Vista is a great place for fast, inexpensive dinner with friends.  A good stand by!  I've always had super service and delicious food anytime I've been here.

This is not authentic Mexican food but they do serve a quality dish. The ingredients seemed fresh but the way they were presented was lame. Salad and "Mexican" rice accompany almost everything which is a dead giveaway at how unauthentic BV is. I wouldn't mind going back but I know it wont be as good as most Mexican places.

I am so sad that we live in West Lincoln Park now since I used to live right next door to Buena Vista. I really need to venture east just to get the cheese appetizer and their guacamole. I asked the waitress if the guacamole has cilantro in it (since it always does) and if I could possibly get it without. They whipped out a batch within minutes - doesn't get any fresher than that! The food was soo good, huge portions, and soo inexpensive. Best Mexican place in the city, and it's so overlooked! Also BYOB puts a cherry on top. The staff is so kind.

We ate here last night and I was pleasantly surprised to find delicious and relatively healthy Mexican food close to our house! The menu here covers all of the typical Mexican favorites, however it adds in a few extras such as a rich mole sauce and several fresh salsas. We were warmly greeted at this family establishment and quickly brought water, chips, and two fresh salsas.  We ordered the vegetable burrito with mole sauce and the salsa verde cheese enchilladas.  Both were served with rice and beans (contrary to other yelp reviews, these were vegetarian).  Our food was quickly prepared and the portions were HUGE! The only glitch was that we used a coupon with which the staff was unfamiliar and they made us feel slightly uncomfortable. Oh yeah, the horchata was great as well!  Woo hoo!
A yummy, little, somewhat-Americanized Mexican joint. Outdoor seating for nice days, and overall, good food.

Fresh, delicious (non-greasy) Mexican Food + BYOB + Very Inexpensive = I love Buena Vista! This place is truly a hidden gem on Broadway. Try the Chicken Burrito, Fajitas or Enchiladas Suizas. You will not be disappointed and your wallet will give you a big hug!
Did you just put a birds eye blend in my veggie burrito then smother it in barbecue sauce? Please try again!

i wanted to like this place. i really, really wanted to like this place. i always WANT to like mexican, but i never do. especially in chicago. but i'm always let down... and i was today. i have to say, the taco was good. i will give them that. i couldn't finish the tostada, not because portion was huge... because the tostada was stale. ick-y! so that didn't go down, but i did eat the toppings. pretty good. the queso... no good. the shell tasted like the shrink wrap it was wrapped in... the cheese was barely melted and super salty. no, thanks. it makes me sad... because i really DID want to like this. although when i picked up the food, the one guy who helped me was pretty nice. it took awhile to get someone's attention that i was there for pick-up though. i probably should have just gone to chipotle.

This was the very first Mexican restaurant I ate at after moving to Chicago.  It is awesome!! Great food and great service! Even better are the prices - extremely affordable!! It's BYOB and has outdoor seating which is great for people watching too.  It's a great lil hole in the wall place that can be easily missed, but you definitely want to check it out!  I will be going back!

I absolutely love love love this place. The cheese enchiladas are fantastic compared to most mexican restaurants in the city. I like the staff and how it's small and quaint. It's also right next to my apartment which is sweet. Recommended!
I go here pretty often and have never been let down. Food is alway fresh, hot and tasty. The staff is friendly and prompt. I have tried 60% of the menu and always leave full and happy.

we  come back afther 10 years to this mexican restaurant........same great service ,good food ,good prices and new adicions in the menu one of my favorites in the area ......... mr .benjamin the owner very good guy   pluss is byob awesome :)
My lovely Puerto Rican wife and I get pickup from here about weekly. They are slowly helping me to convince her that Mexican food is as good as PR food. Always great, quick, and fresh.

Love the beef tacos here! Very flavorful. Meat is tender, the cilantro is fresh, perfect! My new fave place for tacos. Chips and salsa here is also very good. We order delivery here and I live up in Wrigley, which isn't far from Lakeview and for some odd reason, they charge me extra which is a bummer. Delivery is fast, food comes in about 35 minutes! I have discovered their shrimp tacos which are great, but wow, expensive. They tack on an extra 2 or maybe 3 bucks on top of the taco. I don't think a taco is worth 4 or 5 bucks? I usually end up getting one steak and one shrimp taco.

It's easy to overlook Buena Vista--there are a decent number of Mexican dining options in the area, and this small restaurant can easily get lost in the shuffle. I've been going there on-and-off for dinner and takeout for quite some time now and I've never been disappointed.  The staff is really friendly and attentive. The food itself is great, and they offer a decent number of vegetarian friendly options (note, however, that the rice is not vegetarian). The restaurant is BYOB and they have a small outdoor seating area for the summertime which is great for people watching along Broadway. The best thing about the place, in my opinion, is that the prices are so affordable. I ate there with 3 friends a few nights ago and we all had entrees and our combined bill was a little over $30--a steal for 4 people, I think. Try the fried ice cream...you will not regret it.

i'm writing about the mole. on the enchiladas. having never tasted mole before, i somehow have this intuition that this is good mole. the owners confidence in his homemade recipe helped, but the curious thing was that the more i had, the more convinced i was that it was weird but oddly pleasant and enjoyable. 20 min into the meal, somehow all the mole which at one point smothered the enchiladas entirely was gone, as were the yummy free chips and dips. a day later, i'm curiously craving some more. the mole beast has been unleashed! thanks buena vista!
very good chips and salsa , the chicken and steak tacos were very very good, tacos were huge and our order came out quickly , highly recommended ....

Having lived around the corner from Buena Vista for 3 years I finally decided to stop by for dinner one night and I wasn't disappointed. While it is a bit small on the inside, we were able to get the window seat which is always great for people watching along Broadway.   We ordered the guac appetizer and it was a bit bland, not as salty or spicy as I have had before but they serve it in a really cute tortilla bowl which makes the novelty worth it.  I had the mini chimichangas  and they were delicious.  The portion was huge (5) and I couldn't finish them all in one sitting.   I haven't tried the breakfasts yet but I am looking forward to ordering them soon.  I also like that there is horchata on the menu because I feel that it can be hard to find on some Mexican restaurant menus in Lakeview.

This place has suddenly become a once-a-week spot for me! MAJOR ALERT!!  YOU MUST try the Queso Fundido with Chorizo for an appertizer! Picture it:  ooey gooey chihauhua cheese and greasy ground-up chorizo steaming out of a taco shell bowl.   Yes, a taco shell bowl. You know it's not the least bit healthy, but it's so freaking good who cares?!  Two gyms are within a few blocks distance. It's so huge you could turn it into your meal.   One more tidbit - they are now on  restaurant.com , so buy a gift certificate - your meal will cost next to nothing!
Don't know what else you could want, Good food. BYOB. Reasonable prices. Friendly staff.

Awesome prices, awesome food. Everyone was very friendly, and the service was decent.  Chips and salsa were both fresh and homemade! And the chips were warm and crispy, which was a big plus. I ordered a beef burrito. ($5.50) Food came out super fast and the portion was huge! Easily two meals. It was filled with lots of meat, and other yummy goodness. The guacamole was just ok, nothing that great. The only negative is that the restaurant is super small. Only 10 tables in the whole place.

GREAT food!!  Possibly the best mexican food I've found in the neighborhood.  The only reason I don't give it 5 stars is because our service was really, really, really bad.  But the food.... SO GOOD!!!  The beans and rice were so flavorful.  I ordered the enchiladas with mole sauce.  My mouth is watering just thinking about it.  I'll definitely be returning for takeout.  Also it's BYOB, which I normally like, but I love a good margarita with my enchiladas.  Yes, definitely will be back for takeout.

I can't give this three stars, because I wouldn't want to eat the guacamole there ever again.  I'm a guacamole fiend, and that makes or breaks a restaurant for me.  I just love it, and if I can't love your guac, I can't love your restaurant.  It's not that it was bad, it just wasn't...good. The restaurant wasn't all bad, though.  I actually REALLY liked the pastor meat that came on my tostada.  Unfortunately, I didn't like the ground beef in my taco, the rice was humdrum, the salsas were both waaay too spicy for me and my boyfriend, and he also didn't like his tamale.  However, he also really enjoyed his chicken flautas he ordered for his dinner.  So there was good to go along with the not good.  I'm just not sure there was enough good.

LOVE this place! very small but did not get to busy.  Chips and guac were excellent to start with.  BYOB with no cork fee - awesome! I got the taco dinner - the chicken was great, juicy white meat. came with rice and beans, these are the best refried beans i have ever had. 2 friends had enchilada and carne estada, both said theirs was excellent as well. absolutley recommend!

This has definitely become my favorite mexican place. It's really, really good. I have yet to order anything besides the Enchiladas here, and I really want to every single time, but they are so good I just can't bring myself to order something different. Maybe next time :) But, the owner is always super friendly. The service is always great. The food is always really good, and they always get it right. It's reasonably priced, BYOB, and I just love it. It's good stuff.
This place is so cute, tasty and cheap why would you go anywhere else and spend 3x as much?  You can even BYO margaritas!   And the patio seating in the summer is a double bonus.

This is a tiny little restaurant.  I think they have maybe 8 tables, but for being a tiny restaurant they do have good Mexican food.  It is what I have come to know for Mexican food.  It's  a BYOB (+1 star) and there is a liquor store across the street (walk softly to not knockdown any champagne bottles, you'll understand).  My Mexican friend even enjoyed their food.  He was pleased that they had Menudo (look that one up yourself).

I just had a really bad experience here. This was disappointing because I'd had a reasonably good experience here once before.  I ordered an enchilada mole with steak for take out. They prepared it fast, but when I got home, I couldn't bite into the steak bits. It was like I got all scraps from the steak. Only maybe one in three was edible. Also, the sauce melted the styrofoam container all the way through in three spots and all the sauce was in the bag and made a big mess on my table.  I was left wondering whether there was actually styrofoam/plastics in my dinner.  I'm disappointed because I'd hoped a take-out would be as good as a sit down here. Maybe they can fix this one for me.

Absolutely disgusting. I ordered two ground beef tacos a la carte and specifically said NO TOMATO.  What did I get?  Heaps of tomato.  The tacos were cold when I got them and the side order of rice was dry and bland. I will never order from this place again.

This place is a great place to go for good cheap Mexican.  The owners/serving staff are so nice and the food is really great.  I prefer their tacos to Chipotle's (only a few steps away) and the other options on the menu are great as well.  Plus, the guac is so fresh.  Bring your own ____ (tequila and margarita mix, beer, wine, etc) and have a great night! Definitely worth a try.

the food here was awesome...i had the enchiladas verdes and my friend had vegetable fajitas.  we were pleasantly surprised by how fresh and delicious everything was.  the servers were really nice and we each paid a little over $10 including tip and tax.  Pretty sweet since we had both had leftovers!

Great food! Went here for a birthday dinner with 6 people and they were very helpful about pushing tables together for us.  Four people at our table got enchiladas and we were all impressed.  $12 a person after tip... great food, great service and big portions. A nice little find in Lakeview. Will definitely be returning!

I've been eating at this place for many years now and I have never had a bad experience... The taco dinner is always a safe bet and extremely filling for only like $6-7... And their chicken burrito is one of the tastiest I've ever had, only second to a place in the Haight-Ashbury district of San Francisco I frequented often on my last visit out West... Fast service and decent prices, this is definitely the best option for Mexican food if you're walking up and down Broadway...

I recently attended a big reunion dinner with some friends, and for reasons I don't know, the organizer selected Buena Vista as the restaurant.  Everyone was baffled upon arrival because the place resembles the late night Mexican places you stumble into on the way home from the bars.  Yet this one actually accepts reservations and calls itself BYOB.  And considering it was working against all odds, it didn't disappoint. They somehow managed to clear out 6 of their 8 tables to make a big group table for us.  The service was pretty darn spot on, popping out with more chips/salsa/water as soon as asked.  The salsas were good, but a little too spicy for me.  I couldn't stop eating them, but my mouth was on fire after a while.  I got the enchiladas mole with ground beef and was not disappointing.  They were tasty and very filling. And the bill came to $11 each with tax and tip!  Haha.  That's almost jokingly low if you ask me.  No complaints there though!

When in East Lakeview, this is my go-to lil Mexican joint....my roommate and I used to go all the time.  Food is generally good (some things more than others), I never get anything with steak so can't agree nor disagree with the complaints, but the chicken is usually good, and their breakfasts are yummy, though I guess it's hard to screw up juevos a la Mexicana.  Their chips and salsa (three different types), both of which are made fresh on-site, are excellent.  Prices are low....not sure if they take plastic, I think they do, though.  The owner, Chuy, is a very nice guy....he even let us use his bathroom and gave us water during the Gay Pride Parade a couple years ago (my roommate knows him, I guess that helps).

I am forever searching for Mexican food, not because I can't find any i like, but just because I LOVE it and am always up for a new place. This little gem is conveniently located on the end of my street and I am yet to be disappointed by them. I always order enchiladas with just cheese in them (weird, I know) and to spice it up a little I get the Verde sauce. It comes with a really generous portion of rice and beans, very standard but it is so delicious.  I kind of don't like how Yelp fills in the 4 or 5 stars with little expressions for you, "Woohoo! As good as it gets!" It's like I want to give this 5-stars but I'm not saying you will never find another mexican place as good as this one. You probably will, but for a little hole-in-the-wall joint, this place is serving up some pretty darn good food.

The first time I came here I thought the food was pretty good. Chicken enchiladas...yum. Maybe I was just super hungry? Or just excited that I had a coupon to use? But when I went a second time and ordered them again, they were only ok. Kind of flavorless and bland. Plus it took forever to get my water refilled because the all of 7 tables in there were occupied and there was only 1 waiter working. That's always annoying to me. The prices are reasonable, though, and if you're just looking for a cheap Mexican food fix, this place is somewhat better than your average quickie food stop.

I used to live across the street from Buena Vista and have eaten there many times. It has really amazing food and service and has never disappointed me. The environment is cozy and intimate but also relaxed and casual. I absolutely love their mole burritos. The prices are very good. Buena Vista is my favorite Mexican restaurant.

Oh, Gawd.  Every time I get excited about trying one of the umpteen untested dives in my neighborhood, I always get burned.  Rarely do I have luck at these icky little Mexican food places. My Sunday lunch started well.  The waiter--no older than 16--was really nice and attentive.  The interior was clean and tidy; the place was nearly full but the service never went down.  I thought, Great...I finally found a place that might be my fave cheap Mexican restaurant. The good feelings ended about the fifth bite into my Burrito Suizo when I found a bone mixed in with the below par chopped "steak."  A few bites more, and I hit a large patch of gristle.  Oh, no...I started to seriously wonder if this meat came from a cow or some poor three-legged animal that came too close to the restaurant's back door. So I asked the waiter to take back the Burrito Suizo Meat Surprise and bring me a simple cheese burrito--no sauces, no sides of beans or rice.  Just a plain ol' burrito.  Well, that's what I got.  A burrito filled with nothing but shredded cheddar cheese.  Oh, joy. And that's how the meal ended.

I really enjoyed Buena Vista, but I'm so disappointed in myself for not trying this place earlier!  I always heard that it was great, and to not judge it by it's crappy overhead sign.  There is outdoor seating and minimal indoor seating, but this place serves quality Mexican. With an extensive menu of apps, dinner, lunch, and a la carte(choose from this menu, actually a lot cheaper) this place has it all--EXCEPT Margaritas...damn. They use real chicken...not the bits n dicey pieces some crappy places serve. Service is super quick and they have great chips! The salsa is ok, they have both red and salsa verde. I would suggest the burritos and tacos, chicken or steak, both great!

This is one of those blink and you miss it hole in the wall dives that has super yummy food.  Both times I have been there I have been satisfied.  I had steak encheladas verdes (I heart the green sauce) the first time and they were awesome.  The second time I went there I had carne asada and it was equally as yummy.  I love ordering the Jarritos Mexican pop!  Yummy on a hot summer day.  And the great part is that both times the meals for two people were just a smidge over $20 with tip.

I love this place. It's so inexpensive and the food is tasty. It's the only BYOB Mexican place I know of in the neighborhood. The service has been very good. Their chicken enchiladas mole are solid. Also - their salsa is very spicy, which is great, and they bring out two kinds.
The food was very good, it was the extremely poor service that garnered Buena Vista only two stars. The waiter was both rude and tremendously neglectful.

Great outdoor spot on Broadway.  $4.95 for a football sized steak burrito.  Guacamole was bland.  Steak was a little chewy, but for the price and the location with outdoor seating, it's a great value.   Good service, too.  BYOB!

To me, Buena Vista is going downhill. For the past few times I have gone to visit, the steak has gotten chewier and chewier, almost to make me want to vomit. The chicken is bland so I cant really trade off. I can only imagine what cut of beef that steak is and/or the quality grade. My assumptions is grade F.  To make matters worse, the server (there are only 2), has gotten significantly more rude. Like Sir, I dont get what your deal is, but chewy steak and poor service wont be good for business. Maybe he was having a bad day, but it was a real turn off. I find myself going less and less, which is not a good sign. Chips and salsa are still top notch.
This place is awesome...I've been there more times than I can count!  Everything I've had has always been very fresh tasting, and their guac and salsa are delicious!

I stopped in for dinner not long ago.  I've walked past Buena Vista for months and I decided to check it out.  The interior is forgettable and shabby but who cares - it's a neighborhood joint and quite comfortable with that identity.  I thought the food was 2 - 3 stars.  The guac was bland, the enchilada was better.  Good service.  Overall, not bad but nothing to write home about.

I haven't had many dining experiences in my life that I would call disgusting but I ate here last summer and I still cringe every time I walk by.  I had the vegetarian burrito and it was so gross I felt embarrassed for everybody working there.

Took my in-laws here before a Saturday night iO show. DEEEEEEEEEE-licious! Dinner portions are huge, guacamole is delicious, owner/waitstaff is very attentive, chips appear to be homemade and are super tasty. :o) I left here with a very full stomach--and a very happy one. We'll probably order less next time (hubby had two tacos, I got the fajita dinner which was delicious, but I couldn't finish it all), and we'll definitely be back!

I've been going here pretty often for the past few months. I LOVE Mexican food and this place is pretty consistent every time. Although, speaking of consistent, I always get the chicken tacos, so I should probably switch it up a bit. But I am a big fan of those. The guac is also very fresh and delicious. I like to say this place is a nice mix of cheap Mexican food and a cute sit-down restaurant. Though the menu items are pretty "standard" and very similar to what you'd find at most cheaper Mexican restaurants, this one is very cozy, has friendly service, and is much better than your average "drunk $4 taco at 3 a.m." place.
Nearly all mexican restaurants serve identical food.  This one lets you bring your own booze.

Pros: Delivery, I was lazy and ordered out two days in a row. Cheap I got a taco dinner, nachos, and chips and salsa with the delivery charge all for 20 bucks. The salsa. It's spicy and delicious. That's all I got (to say). It's also why I ordered from here twice because I doubt they'd just deliver the salsa without a meal. If they start to though, someone let me know. Cons: Just your average mexican I might try something else but what I had was nothing special. (except the salsa)

There are a lot of choices for Mexican food around this area, but Buena Vista is my favorite of the bunch. I always get the tacos (the chicken and pork are both great) and some guacamole. I really want to try something new, but the tacos keep calling my name every time.  I absolutely love the charm of this place. It's cozy and the server/manager/owner? is very attentive and absolutely adorable.  Somewhere in Lakeview might have slightly better food, but with the consistently great food and service of Buena Vista, I'm in no rush to take the chance to find out.

Im new to Yelp.  Well not really, I use it everyday, but I just became a member, so I wanted to write one review, but I got hungry so I think this is like my 7th review.  I should really eat something.   I love this little place.  I got enchiladas verdes last time and they were awesome.  They were really spicy, pero me encanta comida picante.  It was a ton of food too.  So even though its super cheap, you can probably cut your $6/person meal down to $3/person if you share the food.  The waiter is awesome, he is on top of the drink refills.  I might go there tonight.  Its cold outside and oh so close to my apt.
Fast service for carry out, it was ready less than 10 minutes after we called.  Food was pretty good too, I'd definitely go back to try something different.

Cute little BYOB place in the worst neighborhood on Earth.  Typical Chicago cheap mexican food, made by people who want you to have a decent meal.  Above average salsas (green and red served with your chips), excellent mole, large portions. If you can stuff your ears and ignore the neighborhood's self centered and rude diners, you'll have a good quick Mexican meal... But maybe ask yourself why the hell you are in that neighborhood in the first place...

easily my favorite Mexican restaurant in all of Chicago....I've been going here for years. cheap. quality. good portions. great owner (who is actually from Mexico and goes home to visit every winter....). I could go on.  Oh, their Horchata is worth a taste, and feel free to byob as they'll keep it cold and even bring you limes!

carne asada dinner con frijoles, arroz, guacamole y cebolla FTW! nice people working, though no alcohol, no byo...so flask it, order the pina colada and spice up your life. not much table space, so maybe deliver or take out too.

This is me and my boyfriend's favorite place for Mexican in my neighborhood.  We are both obsessed with Mexican and once I moved to the area began searching for the best place for our usual Steak Burrito and Chicken Enchiladas.  Buena Vista was the winner!  The man that has always helped us (I think he's the owner?) is so kind and attentive.  The service is so quick and the food never disappoints.  It's an adorable little place, surprisingly good for a date!  I also love being able to people watch at one of the window tables.  Mmmm!

Went here the other night with my wife.  I had the mole enchiladas with steak ($7.50) and she had ground beef tacos ($6).  Mine was delicious -- the sauce was tasty, the steak tender and well seasoned.  Hers wasn't too bad either but basic.  Both came with refried beans and mexican rice.  Chips with two different salsas on the house.  It was plenty of food.  It's also BYOB.   Great mexican food for the price.
so-so I had delivery from here tonight.  The steak fajitas is the way to go. Wonderfully seasoned and a good sized portion.  The rest of the food was so-so. Torta and salsa were a bit boring.

If you happen to be in the neighborhood craving mexican food, this is a good option. I like the mole chicken enchiladas....BUT I always have to add something because I agree with some of the previous reviews, it is somewhat bland. The salsa is pretty decent and it's BYOB (a big plus!). Also, the two gentlemen that run this place are very nice and attentive.  Beware of the steak enchiladas because I had them the other day and it was weird.  The ground beef ones are good.  Again, I think it's somewhat bland in general but, I have it from a reliable source that a lot of Mexican  restaurants do this because they assume that Americans won't like too much spice.

The guys that man this station are truly kings among men. There aren't too many places in east lakeview to satisfy your late night cravings. I had a giant veggie burrito with chips and salsa, and felt I got more than enough food for my 5 bucks and change.  I came here on a Saturday, almost 4am, wasn't in the mood for sleeping, but was in the mood for eating. I found myself in quite the pickle. Luckily this place was open, not to mention hopp'n, and I was able to scratch that burrito itch digging into my stomach. This place is an east lakeview staple.  The food is decent, while I've had better, BUT they are open as late as 5-A-M. You stumble in, get hot fresh greasy wonderful food, you get your green and red salsas both nice and hot and your belly will be happy. All as late as 5 AM. These guys are truly providing a valuable service. Let me reiterate: Kings.Among.Men.

This place is in my top Mexican restaurants to eat at.  1) It's cheap, 2) The waiter is always really nice and attentive (same guy as every other time I've eaten here), 3) location right in the heart of Lake View that is quaint, 4) the food is EXCELLENT with large portions that you can't stop eating more of.  They always give me a pile of extra cilantro when I ask for it, yummm.  Beware of the salsa because both the roja and verde are VERY spicy for us sensitive ones.  I also always get the Sangria grape juice or the Horchata which is one of the best I've ever drank. You would not know that it was so good by the store front windows, but give it a try!

I'm so glad my boyfriend and I wandered into this amazing restaurant. It's a very unassuming store front. Feel free to walk right in and grab a table. The owner is very sweet and is also the waiter. If you want a margarita, you'll have to bring your own, it's strictly BYOB. Chips and salsa are great, the salsa is definitely spicy, if you're not good with hot foods, ask for two waters. We ordered quesadillas, chicken tacos, and my boyfriend had a burrito. The quesadillas were good, nice and cheesy, slightly greasy, but definitely hit the spot. Chicken tacos were exceptional, definitely my #2 go to place for tacos. Burritos are huge! You can probably get 2 meals out of 1 burrito. My boyfriend liked it, but said the sauce was "kind of funky." Buena Vista is cheap! $21 for an appetizer and two entrees. I love this local family owned business. I'll definitely be back!

Went there because of all the good reviews and I was a little disappointed. Had the steak burrito suizo and it was just okay.  The burrito was a good size but had a couple of pieces of fatty gristly steak in it but had a decent flavor.

Although I don't think this place is anything to write home about, it serves decent "Mexican" food, quick, fast, and hot.  So why am I giving it four stars? Well, the horchata was pretty amazing. It tasted like liquid rice pudding. Not to mention that the portions are hefty and the salsa is absolutely spicy-licious. I'll probably go back here, if only because it's sort of close, I know it won't make my insides curdle, and because the folks who work there are pretty friendly. I'm glad I finally got here. You should too?

Went to Buena Vista last night, looking for a good and cheap mexican meal.  We brought a six pack and our appetites and we had a great experience. The place was almost full when we got there, so we had to squeeze three people around a table up against the wall but it turned out to be only a minor inconvenience.  The staff was very friendly and the service was fast and accurate.   The chips and salsa were delicious but beware, they definitely come with a kick!  The carne asada was delicious, everything was fresh and tasty.   We got the check and the bill was $27 for three dinners!  Buena Vista is a great place to satisfy your mexican craving, while still saving enough money to go out and get some drinks afterwards!

I have not had chilaquiles in years ... but I tried them at this place and they were soooooooo good.  My friend had the pozole which, quite honestly, was not at all original in flavoring but it will curve a craving if you know what the original stuff tastes like.  The portions are huge ... which usually offsets the taste ... I ate just a 1/3 of my plate and I was completely full.  So, take home is likely a must unless you have quite a large appetite.  Overall, pretty decent place ... highly enjoyed the breakfast!

I opened the burrito and saw the size.....seriously, I was soooo excited that I found a new spot that has good burritos.   I was disappointed to say the least.  First bite was great.  2nd bite was great.  Then the rest of the burrito was filled with really fatty and tendon-y meat.  =(   It made me sad.   But...I'm going to give this place another shot....because if the meat weren't so fatty and tendon-y, it would've been awesome. BTW, the burritos are huge.  Think Chipotle, packed with everything you can think of....yeah.... ****Update**** Ok, so I finally went back to give it another try.  The meat was MUCH better this time.

From the store front to the dining area, you wouldn't expect much from this restaurant by looks alone.  However, the food is amazing and fresh and cheap!  It's the perfect combo...oh did I forget that it is BYOB? !?!

My favorite mexican food in Chicago..... Total hole in the wall environment - you will see the same two guys running the whole restaurant every time you stop in. I have been here probably a dozen times and am never disappointed.  As everyone has said the highlights include: BYOB, inexpensive food, fast service, and most importantly delicious food. I recommend trying their mini chimichangas (the mini chimis as we call 'em).  Again, don't go with a group larger than four as there just isn't enough seating and you will end up in another table's conversation.
Very good, unassuming little place. There is an old guy in the back cooking, which I'm sure he's been doing since before I was born. Two people can get a great Mexican dinner for under $20. BYOB

This place is great!  I went there for the first time last night.  The food is cheap, wonderful, and there are huge portions, so we were able to take home leftovers.  The beans are also vegetarian, which is somewhat rare at Mexican restaurants.  We'll definitely be back!!

I've gotten take out here on several occaissions and finally had the chance to eat in recently. The portions are huge and the prices are low, but more importantly this is some of the best Mexican food in the city. The service inside can be slow, and there is no ambiance to speak of, but consider that it is just one person running table and take out service.  The queso fundido is excellent. Huge, cheesy, and served with a ton of flour tortillas. My husband swears by the burrito with rice and beans. He easily gets two big meals out of it. The guacamole and salsa are quite good. The enchiladas and rice and beans are all fantastic and the real standout, the mole sauce, is the best I have ever had. It is the perfect mix of chocolately, spicey and smokey. I often just pick up a side of it and take it home to make nachos with.
I love that I can call in my order, and by the time I get there my food is waiting for me.  I could eat the stake tacos everyday! I will never go to Chipotle again.
Great Mexican restaurant in Lakeview. The portion size is quite generous and excellent for the price. Service is quick and friendly.

Great little Mexican restaurant. One of my favorites. I like that it is small and the owner takes your order. Food is good and inexpensive. great chicken flautas. I am amazed that there are people lined out the door for Chipotle which is a block or two away, when they can get real & better tasting Mexican food for less money down the block.

Excellent portions, decent prices, and above average food make this one of my favorite Mexican spots in the city.  Based on those three factors it would be a four star restaurant but there is more. They serve glass bottle coke here.  Not only is it glass bottle, it is a big glass bottle.  And not only is it a big glass bottle, it is made in Mexico.  Which means that they use cane sugar to make it.  And it is deeeeelicious.  If you so choose, you can get them to buy cases of the glass bottle coke for you. When I used to spend a lot of time in this neighborhood on summer days, I could not often walk by without popping in to get a coke.

This place is easily my new favorite Mexican restaurant.  My husband & I can order appetizers & entrees for under $30 including tip.  I haven't found an item that I disliked, & between my husband & I, we've tried a lot!  My husband really likes this place because all their chicken dishes use only white meat.

stopped in on a whim with a friend one night. great service and chips with green salsa and red salsa. i wasn't super satisfied with my chicken mole burrito. though it was HUGE and full of all white meat chicken which is impressive, but it didn't really taste like much. my friend had something with chorizo, which he said was tasty. will definitely go again and try something else. good for when you don't want to spend a lot but don't one the usual 3am  mexican fare.
A big, tasty, satisfying chicken mole burrito for under $5 -- Count me in!

Based on previous reviews, I recently decided to check out Nueva Buena Vista, and I was so pleasantly suprised! Walking by on the street, the place looks so unassuming and a little wishy-washy, but venture inside and it quickly becomes quite charming.  Scents of a true Mexican restaurant with brighly coloured paintings and Mexican music. I lived in Mexico briefly, and even there I did not have mole as good as I did at this place. Really nutty and complex with that great hint of chocolate. Neverending supplies of fresh chips with salsa verde and regular salsa (which has an intersting, slightly italian flavour) are also plentiful.  Is quite small, so best for a duo, although they also deliver.

This unassuming place is the highest quality quick Mexican food in the neighborhood. While they did redecorate the small interior so it's pretty nice, and they serve beer, it's still cheap takeout. My favorite are the steak or chicken burritos with mole sauce. Their mole is far superior to your standard dives. Good size too. They also serve Coke in glass bottles (probably imported from Mexico) which is a nice nostalgia.

This little joint on Broadway has good and greasy chorizo burritos and refreshing horchata drinks among its rather typical Mexican menu. If you eat here you will get a basket of tortilla chips too, but I usually order to go. The burritos are fairly big so you should not go hungry afterwards.
